author: Sara Strickland
title: Food First NL Welcomes National School Food Program
text:
Food First NL says they are excited about news that the federal government is putting $1-billion toward a national school food program over the next five years.
The program, announced by Prime Minister Justin Trudeau
earlier this week, is expected to provide healthy lunches to an additional 400,000 school-aged children across Canada every year.
Program coordinator and lead for school food Ashley Byrne says the program has been a long time coming, noting that Canada was the only G7 country without such a program in place.
Byrne explains that there is now support at both the federal and provincial levels of government for school food in the province.
As Byrne explains, a quarter of children across the province live in food insecure households.
She says school meals are not yet universally available here, especially in rural and remote communities. She describes a “patchwork” system involving many different programs and styles, so for children living with food insecurity the national program is a big deal.

title: Realtimecampaign.com Discusses the Importance of Enhancing Operations with Fleet Management Software | User | times-online.com
text: Fleet management software plays a pivotal role in the contemporary digital landscape, especially within the realm of computer security software. This technology, evolving rapidly, offers comprehensive solutions to manage, track, and maintain vehicle fleets in various industries. It integrates sophisticated software engineering with robust security measures to ensure the safety and efficiency of fleet operations. The Core of Fleet Management: Security and Efficiency The integration of fleet management software into daily operations is not just about tracking vehicles; it's about ensuring the integrity and security of data related to those vehicles. In a world where cyber threats are increasingly sophisticated, the importance of secure fleet management cannot be understated. This software typically includes features like real-time vehicle tracking, maintenance scheduling, fuel management, and driver performance monitoring. However, its core value lies in its ability to safeguard sensitive data against unauthorized access and cyber threats. Operational Efficiency and Data Management One of the key aspects of this technology is its contribution to operational efficiency, according to realtimecampaign.com. Companies using these technologies have noted significant improvements in their operations. This improvement is not just in terms of vehicle tracking but also in data management and security. By using these tools, businesses can monitor their fleet in real-time, ensuring that vehicles are being used efficiently and safely. The Emergence of Innovators in Fleet Management Another significant development in the realm of fleet management is the emergence of MetTel . This company has been at the forefront of integrating advanced technology into fleet management solutions. Their products are known for their robust security features, ensuring that the fleet data is protected against cyber threats. This is crucial in an era where data breaches can have severe financial and reputational consequences for companies. The Future of Fleet Management: 2023 and Beyond The year 2023 has seen the evolution of this software with the introduction of some of the Best Fleet Management Software of 2023 options. This new generation of software comes equipped with enhanced features like advanced analytics, improved user interfaces, and more robust security protocols. These advancements are not just about tracking and maintaining vehicles; they're about providing a comprehensive, secure, and efficient tool for managing all aspects of a fleet. Adapting to Cyber Threats in Fleet Management In the context of computer security, the significance of his response to the evolving cyber threat landscape is crucial. It highlights the need for continuous improvement and adaptation in security measures within fleet management software. As cyber threats become more sophisticated, the software must evolve to provide robust protection against potential breaches and data theft. Fleet management software stands as a testament to the power of technology in enhancing business operations while ensuring data security. Its role in the modern digital landscape is multifaceted, providing tools for efficient vehicle management, data protection, and operational optimization. As technology continues to advance, we can expect this software to become even more integral to the smooth running of fleet operations, underpinned by stringent security measures to safeguard against ever-evolving cyber threats. author: Anonym
title: Fire show on New Year's Day is well received - but limited visibility causes criticism - The Limited Times
text:
Status: 02.01.2024, 20:00 PM
By: Manuela Schauer
CommentsPrint Share
Flames on head and hands: For half an hour, the artists of the Philgor company present their fire show in front of the numerous spectators. © Dominik Bartl
The days of fireworks on New Year's Day are over. For the first time, the Pro Gast Tourismus association offered a fire show at the Ammergauer Haus. In principle, this was well received, but there is room for improvement.
Oberammergau – Sparks fly from a guitar. Men juggle torches while flaming fountains shoot into the air. Film music blares out of the speakers, as well as classics like "We will rock you" by Queen. The main thing is that the piece has bums. In keeping with the dull thud, Philgor's team takes the audience into the world of fire. Impresses with artistically hot choreographies and LED interludes on the truss scaffolding.
But there is a shadow over the luminous, half-hour performance on Monday evening. Many of the onlookers can hardly see them or not at all, so some leave them early.
Very good response For the first time, the tourist office Pro Gast organized a fire show. As a replacement for the popular professional fireworks. Since 2012, this had attracted numerous guests and locals to the sports grounds on New Year's Day. With Corona, the event died, but mainly for noise and environmental reasons. An alternative was needed. With Philgor from Munich, the association landed fire professionals. "The response was very good," says Thomas Knöpfle, the second chairman, when asked by Tagblatt. Despite minimal advertising.
In advance, the association could not estimate how many people would make a pilgrimage to the spa gardens. In the end, there were around 800, Knöpfle estimates. More than expected. "It was jam-packed." On the one hand, this speaks in favor of the event, but on the other hand, it raised a problem. People were glued to each other to catch a glimpse of the flaming spectacle. This was primarily reserved for the front rows. What was going on in front of the stage of the pavilion could only be guessed at by those at the back. The result: disgruntled visitors.
Improve your concept Knöpfle considers the event, which was supported by sponsors and the municipality, to be a success in principle, but absolutely understands the criticism. Especially for children, most of whom stood close to the stage or took a box seat on the shoulders of their parents, the fire show was a "great experience". In any case, it had fulfilled the ideas of the association. However, he also disliked the cramped space and limited visibility. An experience for next time.
He currently assumes that an event will take place there again in 2025. But then with an improved concept. Pro Gast will deal with how this could be optimized. Knöpfle's first thought experiments: install two large screens and move the stalls from the "Ammergau Winter Magic" so that they do not block the view additionally. He actually considers the location per se to be optimal because there are toilets, it is centrally located and within walking distance and the effort in terms of rescue services is lower.
"Ammergau Winter Magic" to be continued Regardless of how and whether the club sets up an offer in the future, one thing is already certain for Maximilian Kasseckert: The "Ammergau Winter Magic" is to be continued. "We definitely want to do it again," emphasizes the tenant of the Ammergau house. The new Christmas market in Oberammergau was well received. Apart from the fact that the stalls had to remain closed on a weekend due to the strong wind, "we can't complain".

author: @maliaga
title: Marcelo Díaz revela el nombre del segundo delantero que Universidad de Chile quiere cerrar: "Está muy cerca" - Bolavip Chile
text:
MERCADO DE FICHAJES Universidad de Chile Marcelo Díaz revela el nombre del segundo delantero que Universidad de Chile quiere cerrar: "Está muy cerca" El periodista quién es el jugador que se acerca a pasos agigantados al cuadro azul. Se sumará a Leandro Díaz. Gonzalo Fouillioux se enfrenta a los haters de Lucas Assadi Johnny Herrera recibe con bombos y platillos a nuevo refuerzo de la U Por Martín Aliaga
Actualizado el 16/01/2025 - 18:47hs CLT
whatsapp Actualizado el 16/01/2025 - 18:47hs CLT
Marcelo Díaz reveló quién es el segundo delantero que se acerca a Universidad de Chile. Universidad de Chile está a detalles de cumplir el deseo de Gustavo Álvarez y compañía. La directiva azul se alista a incorporar dos nombres en ofensiva, el talón de Aquiles del equipo en 2024.
Ello fue confirmado por el propio Michael Clark : el presidente de Azul Azul confesó que las negociaciones con un jugador están muy avanzadas. Ese nombre es Leandro Díaz. Cruzará la cordillera y firmará contrato con los laicos.
A su vez, el timonel destacó que un segundo nombre también se acerca. ¿Quién es? Marcelo Díaz destapó que el fichaje de Octavio Rivero marcha viento en popa . Si no hay inconvenientes, el uruguayo se incorporará al ataque azul.
“Dentro de las cosas que dijo sobre los refuerzos, dijo que van por dos centro delanteros. Con uno ya tienen prácticamente todo acordado y con el otro están muy cerca “, lanzó el periodista en TNT Sports.
“Con el que tienen todo acordado es Leandro Díaz y con el que están muy cerca es Octavio Rivero . Pongo hincapié en que se habló con el cuerpo técnico y acordaron que tienen que ir por dos centro delanteros”, explicó.
En dicha línea, advirtió que el charrúa es la prioridad de Azul Azul y el cuerpo técnico. “ Opción número uno Rivero, dos Rivero, tres Rivero, cuatro Rivero y cinco Rivero . Después viene el resto. Ahí están los esfuerzos”, agregó.
Finalmente, reiteró lo expuesto: se acerca a pasos agigantados al equipo de Gustavo Álvarez. “ Está muy cerca, porque ahí está la esperanza de Universidad de Chile de cerrar el acuerdo con Barcelona de Guayaquil” cerró.
Marcelo Díaz reveló que Universidad de Chile está cerca de Octavio Rivero. Cuándo juega Universidad de Chile El siguiente compromiso de los azules será contra River Plate. Se jugará el viernes 17 de enero, desde las 20:00 horas , en el Estadio Ester Roa Rebolledo de Concepción.

author: Express News Service
title: Green Line extension safety inspection of Bengaluru metro on Tumakuru road completed
text:
BENGALURU: The safety inspection of the 3.17-km Green Line extension of Metro between Nagasandra and Madavara on Tumakuru Road was completed by Commissioner of Metro Rail Safety (CMRS), Southern Circle, A M Choudhary, on Thursday.
All the tests, including the train run, were conducted on the same day, cutting short the two-day inspection planned by the Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Ltd (BMRCL).
The three stations of Manjunath Nagar, Chikkabidarakallu (earlier Jindal Nagar) and Madavara (BIEC) figure on this stretch. Asked about the launch date for the Rs 298-crore line, BMRCL MD Maheshwar Rao told TNIE, “Let us first wait for the result of the inspection from the CMRS. We can move ahead after we get the nod.” A top official said BMRCL plans to have the launch before the end of this month.
“The exact date for the launch will be confirmed only after dates of availability are confirmed by both state and central ministers,” he said. Another official added that since this is a very small stretch, BMRCL may also be permitted to launch on its own without any VIPs involved.
